DataStructureHelper.About: This helper isn't used in code, it's just here to describe the data.
DataStructureHelper.SessionAuthenticationConfidenceLevel: Runs from 0 - 10, 10 being absolutely certain the correct authentication has been determined for the session.
DataStructureHelper.SessionTypeConfidenceLevel: Runs from 0 - 10, 10 being absolutely certain the correct type has been determined for the session.
DataStructureHelper.SessionSeverity: Runs on a scale of 0 - 50 and determines the colours of sessions used by the extension.
DataStructureHelper.SessionSeverityZero: 0 Gray (Uninteresting) - For sessions which don't have any relation to the current trace being analysed for the issue being worked on.
DataStructureHelper.SessionSeverityTen: 10 - Blue (False Positive) - For sessions where an error could be falsely blamed for the issue being investigated.
DataStructureHelper.SessionSeverityTwenty: 20 - Green (Normal) - For sessions where no error condition is found.
DataStructureHelper.SessionSeverityThirty: 30 - Orange (Warning) - For sessions which could present an issue, but are stil expected to be seen in normal working scenarios. HTTP 401s authentication challenges are a good example of this.
DataStructureHelper.SessionSeverityFourty: 40 - Black (Concerning) - For sessions which could be interpretted as a false negative. HTTP 200s containing an error or failure are a good example of this.
DataStructureHelper.SessionSeverityFifty: 50 - Red (Severe) - For sessions where a known error condition has been detected.
